page.title: 01Land NE of Sherburn
page.content: An area of very fertile intensively cultivated farmland. Main crops Wheat, Potatoes, Sugar Beet, Turnips and Kale for sheep. Very little grassland. Sheep mainly on stubble and root crops. Origionally part of post glacial lake Pickering. Soil very often dark peaty loam with sands and clays. Almost a dutch landscape with deep ditches and watercourses. 8 farm steading on area main railway line Malton to Scarborough Bisects the block. Only one road NS from Brompton. Church of St Hilda's quite pictureesque. Large firm of steel erectors Ward Bros. in Sherburn Village. Small timber yard at Heaverthorpe level crossing cutting hardwood chocks for the mines.
